headline.main: How Much for a Life? Try $3 Million to $5 Million

docs.lead_paragraph: YOU'VE watched in horror a dozen times: Scenes of barely recognizable aircraft parts strewn across smoldering moonscapes, with the occasional shoe or child's toy the only reminders of lives snuffed out in unimaginable terror. And no doubt you've wondered when it would be your turn, a thought quickly shrugged away but never truly forgotten. Flying, everyone knows, is a risky business. Any expense that makes it safer thus seems an expense worth making. And the only question most people ask after a crash is how to get the regulators to get off their duffs before the next one.
